definition: Dongba culture of the Nakhi ethnic group of Lijiang 麗江|丽江 in northwest Yunnan
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: I'm doing research on Dongba culture.
The ancient traditional culture of the Naxi ethnic group is the Dongba culture which is based on the Dongba religion.
sentences.chinese: 对纳西族古老的传统文化是东巴文化，以东巴教。

sentences.english: The culture denotes the old traditional cultures of the Naxi Nationality, is "The Dongba Culture".
sentences.chinese: 丽江纳西族的古代传统文化，就是“东巴文化”。

definition: batik (color printing on cloth using wax)
Mosuo ethnic group of Yunnan and Sichuan

Three Parallel Rivers National Park, in mountainous northwest Yunnan World Heritage protected area: the three rivers are Nujian 怒江 or Salween, Jinsha 金沙江 or upper reaches of Changjiang and Lancang 澜沧江 or Mekong
Blang people, one of the 56 ethnic groups officially recognized by the PRC
